course_title: Counselling Approaches and Mental Health Practice

learning_outcomes.description: Have an increased appreciation for the complexity of the human condition and of the neurological and psychological processes involved in human functioning.
Understand the nature trauma conditions and the potential impact that traumatic life events have on the self.
Appreciate the effectiveness of psychotherapy for a wide range of mental health conditions.
Conceptualise and develop comprehensive case formulations based on at least two evidenced-based theories of psychotherapy.
Apply a selected psychotherapy approach to the process of psychotherapy.
Apply a range of focused psychological strategies to case presentations.
Demonstrate critical and reflective reasoning to examine approaches to assessment, treatment planning and psychotherapy.

assessments.task_description:
Your task is to present a client case study in either one of two ways.

Option 1. Play a video-recoding of a client presentation (available via course resources) and present your analysis of the presenting issue and how you would approach counselling the client using either Psychodynamic Interpersonal Psychotherapy (PIT) or Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT) as your theoretical framework.  

Option 2. Play a recording (audio or video) of a counselling session you have conducted and present a review and analysis of the session.

Further details will be provided on blackboard.

assessments.task_description:
Part A: 3000 words

In this assignment your task is to write a reflective essay on how you would apply Psychodynamic Interpersonal Therapy (PIT) to a case study provided in class. In reflecting on your application of PIT you should consider the following:  

  • A brief description of the case and your case formulation (400 words).
  • An outline of the key principles and processes of PIT (1000 words)
  • An outline of the first four counselling sessions that you would likely conduct and any challenges associated with providing counselling support for the client (800 words)
  • Your essay discussion should include reference to relevant literature to support your argument.

Part B: 800 words

In addition to a reflection on the application of PIT, you are also required to consider how the case may have been conceptualised differently if ACT was the principal theoretical approach being applied. What might be the strengths and limitations of ACT applied to this case compared to PIT?
